data.title: The Bold Vision of Grameen Bank’s Muhammad Yunus
data.meta_description: In 2006, Muhammad Yunus was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his pioneering work in the field of microcredit. As the founder of the Grameen Bank in Bangladesh, Yunus demonstrated that lending money to poor people to start businesses could be profitable and could transform their lives by raising them out of poverty. Today, Yunus […]
data.text:
A former McKinsey consultant and foundation executive, Georgia Levenson Keohane writes and advises on social and economic policy and nonprofit management. She lives in New York City.
